refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The avp module provides various functions for the manipulation of attributes.
The name is a left-over from earlier versions of SER where attributes were called ‘attribute-value pairs’ or AVPs for short.

refsect2.title: append_attr_hf (hf, attribute)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request and failure processing.

The append_attr_hf() function appends a new header field value to the header field named by the argument hf. The new value will be populated with the content of the attribute named by the argument attribute. If the argument is missing, the content is taken from the attribute with same name as the header field.

refsect2.title: attr2uri (attribute, part)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request and failure processing.

The attr2uri() function sets the Request-URI to the content of the attribute named by the argument attribute. If the argument part is present, only the part of the Request-URI identified by it will be changed. This mimiks the behavior of many of the core functions that allow manipulation of the Request-URI.
The following values are allowed for the part argument:

varlistentry.listitem: replace the host part of the Request-URI,
replace the host and port parts of the Request-URI,
replace the port part of the Request-URI,
prefix the content of the attribute to the username part of the Request-URI,
the attribute contains an integer specifying the number of characters to be stripped off the beginning of the username part of the Request-URI,
the attribute contains an integer specifyin the number of characters to be stripped off the end of the username part of the Request-URI,
replace the username part of the Request-URI,
replace the username and password parts of the Request-URI.

refsect2.title: attr_destination (attribute)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request and failure processing.
The attr_destination() function sets the destination URI to the content of the attribute named by the argument attribute.

If the destination URI is set, the request will be send to the address determined from that URI instead of the Request-URI. It will carried over into branches together with the Request-URI when a call to append_branch is made.

refsect2.title: attr_equals (attribute, value)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request, reply, and failure processing.

The attr_equals() function checks whether the attribute identified by the argument attribute exists and its value is identical the the value given by the argument value. If so, it returns true and false otherwise.

refsect2.title: attr_equals_xl (attribute, value)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request, reply, and failure processing.

The attr_equals() function checks whether the attribute identified by the argument attribute exists and its value is identical to the xl string given by the argument value. If so, it returns true and false otherwise.
For more information on xl strings, see xprint.

refsect2.title: attr_exists (attribute)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request, reply, and failure processing.
The attr_exists() function checks whether an attribute by the name given by the name of attribute exists and returns true in this case or false otherwise.

refsect2.title: attr_to_reply (hf, attribute)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request and failure processing.

The attr_to_reply() function adds a new header fields value to the final response that will eventually be sent upstream. The name of the header field is given by the argument hf. The content will be taken from an attribute. If the argument attribute is present, it contains the name of the attribute. Otherwise, the header field name from the argument hf will be taken as the name.

refsect2.title: del_attr (attribute)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request, reply, and failure processing.
The del_attr function deletes the attribute identified by the argument attribute.

refsect2.title: del_attrs (group)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request, reply, and failure processing.

The del_attrs() function deletes all attributes from the group of attributes identified by the attribute prefix given through the argument group. For example, to delete all attributes of the From user, call

refsect2.title: dump_attrs (group)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request, reply, and failure processing.

The dump_attrs() dumps a list of the existing attributes and their values to the system log. If the group argument is present, it contains an attribute namespace prefix and limits the output to the attrbutes in that namespace.

refsect2.title: flags2attr (attribute)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request, reply, and failure processing.
The flags2attr() function stores the current state of all the flags in compact form in the attribute identified by the argument attribute.

refsect2.title: insert_attr_hf (hf, attribute)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request and failure processing.

The insert_attr_hf() function inserts a header field value to the header field named by the argument hf with the value of the attribute identified by the argument attribute. If there are already values for that header field, the new value will be prepended before any existing value.
If the optional argument attribute is missing, the name of the attribute is taken from the name of the header field in argument hf.

refsect2.title: print_attr (attribute)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request, reply, and failure processing.
The print_attr() function prints the content of the attribute identified by the argument attribute to the system log.
For a more flexible way of printing messages to the system log that allows to print extra information together with the attribute value, see the xprint module.

refsect2.title: replace_attr_hf (hf, attribute)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request and failure processing.

The replace_attr_hf() function removes all header field values of the header field named by the argument hf and adds a new header field value with the content of the attribute identified by the argument attribute. If the argument attribute is missing, the content of the new header field value will be taken from an argument with the same name as the header field.

refsect2.title: set_attr (attribute, value)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request, reply, and failure processing.
The set_attr() function is a synonym for the set_sattr function and sets the attribute identified by the argument attribute to the string contained in the argument value.
Like set_sattr, it is identical to assinging an string using the assignment operator and is deprecated.

refsect2.title: set_iattr (attribute, value)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request, reply, and failure processing.
The set_iattr() function sets the attribute identified by the argument attribute to the integer value contained in the argument value. If the attribute does not yet exist, it is created.

This function is identical to assinging an integer using the assignment operator and is only kept to retain compatibility with earlier versions of SER. It therefore is deprecated and may be removed in the future.

refsect2.title: set_sattr (attribute, value)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request, reply, and failure processing.
The set_sattr() function sets the attribute identified by the argument attribute to the string contained in the argument value. If the attribute does not yet exist, it is created.

This function is identical to assinging an string using the assignment operator and is only kept to retain compatibility with earlier versions of SER. It therefore is deprecated and may be removed in the future.

refsect2.title: subst_attr (attribute, subst)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request, reply, and failure processing.
The subst_attr() function manipulates the content of the attribute identified by the argument attribute using a subst expression.
A subst expression is identical to the expression used by the sed program’s s command.

refsect2.title: xlfix_attr (attribute)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request, reply, and failure processing.
The xlfix_attr() function evaluates the xl string contained in the attributed identified by the argument attribute and stores the result of the evaluation in the same attribute.
For more information on xl strings, see xprint.

refsect2.title: xlset_attr (attribute, value)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request, reply, and failure processing.
The xlset_attr() function sets the attribute identified by the argument attribute to the evaluated xl string given by the argument value.
For more information on xl strings, see xprint.

refsect2.title: xlset_destination (value)
refsect2.para: Allowed in request processing only.
The xlset_destination() function sets the destination URI to the evaluated content of the xl string given by the argument value.
For details on xl strings, see xprint.
The xlbuf_size parameter defines the size of the buffer that used for evaluation of xl strings. The evaluated string cannot be larger than the size given by this parameter.
